title: municoder - R Package Overview for AI Assistants
text: municoder R package provides programmatic interface municode.com API, enabling users access analyze municipal ordinances (zoning codes, building codes, etc.) thousands U.S. jurisdictions.

title: municoder - R Package Overview for AI Assistants
text: get_states(): List states/territories municode.com coverage get_state_by_abbreviation(state_abbreviation): Look state metadata abbreviation get_clients_in_state(state_abbreviation): Find municipalities state ordinances municode.com

title: municoder - R Package Overview for AI Assistants
text: get_client_metadata(state_abbreviation, client_name): Get detailed information specific municipality get_client_products(client_id): List ordinance types (products) available jurisdiction (e.g., “Zoning”, “Code Ordinances”)

title: municoder - R Package Overview for AI Assistants
text: get_current_version(product_id): Get current version ordinance get_version_history(product_id): List historical versions ordinance get_codes_toc(job_id, product_id): Get table contents ordinance get_section_ancestors(job_id, node_id, product_id): Get ancestor nodes specific section get_section_children(job_id, node_id, product_id): Get child nodes specific section

title: municoder - R Package Overview for AI Assistants
text: get_section_text(node_id, product_id): Extract full text metadata specific ordinance sections get_ordinances_toc(product_id, node_id): Get table contents ordinances time get_ordinance_ancestors(product_id, node_id): Navigate ordinance hierarchy get_ordinance_children(product_id, node_id): Get children ordinance nodes list_ordinances(product_id, node_id): Get ordinances year

title: municoder - R Package Overview for AI Assistants
text: get_product_metadata(client_id, product_name): Get detailed metadata specific product type

title: municoder - R Package Overview for AI Assistants
code: # 1. Find a jurisdiction clients <- get_clients_in_state("VA") alexandria_id <- clients %>%   filter(client_name == "Alexandria") %>%   pull(client_id)  # 2. List available ordinances products <- get_client_products(alexandria_id) zoning_id <- products %>%   filter(product_name == "Zoning") %>%   pull(product_id)  # 3. Get current version job <- get_current_version(product_id = zoning_id) job_id <- job %>% pull(id)  # 4. Navigate table of contents toc <- get_codes_toc(job_id = job_id, product_id = zoning_id)  # 5. Extract specific sections content <- get_section_text(   product_id = zoning_id,   node_id = "ARTIIIREZORE" )

title: municoder - R Package Overview for AI Assistants
text: API uses several types identifiers must obtained sequentially: state_abbreviation: Two-letter state code (e.g., “VA”, “CA”) client_id: Unique identifier municipality (obtained get_clients_in_state()) product_id: Unique identifier ordinance type (obtained get_client_products()) job_id: Unique identifier specific version ordinance (obtained get_current_version()) node_id: Unique identifier section within ordinance (obtained get_codes_toc())

title: municoder - R Package Overview for AI Assistants
text: functions return tidy dataframes snake_case column names, thanks janitor::clean_names(). package uses: - httr2 API requests - dplyr tidyr data manipulation - purrr functional programming - stringr text processing

title: municoder - R Package Overview for AI Assistants
text: build_endpoint(domain, subdomain, parameters): Constructs API URLs components get_endpoint(endpoint): Executes GET requests returns JSON R objects

title: municoder - R Package Overview for AI Assistants
text: endpoints constructed : https://api.municode.com/

title: municoder - R Package Overview for AI Assistants
text: Spatial Analysis: Map ordinance coverage across states/regions Comparative Analysis: Compare ordinance text across jurisdictions Longitudinal Studies: Track ordinance changes time using historical jobs Text Mining: Extract analyze specific regulatory language (e.g., density limits, affordable housing provisions) Zoning Research: Analyze residential zone purposes, permitted uses, development standards

title: municoder - R Package Overview for AI Assistants
text: README demonstrates analyzing Alexandria, VA’s residential zoning “Purpose” statements identify RMF zone unique : - Explicitly mentioning housing affordability - capping unit density purpose statement

title: municoder - R Package Overview for AI Assistants
text: Version: 0.0.0.9000 (development) Author: Curran-Groome License: MIT Installation: renv::install("wcurrangroome/municoder") Documentation: https://wcurrangroome.github.io/municoder/

title: municoder - R Package Overview for AI Assistants
text: Core dependencies: dplyr, httr2, janitor, magrittr, purrr, rlang, stringr, tibble, tidyr

title: municoder - R Package Overview for AI Assistants
text: Three convenience functions simplify common multi-step operations: get_ordinance_section(state_abbr, client_name, product_name, node_id): Get ordinance content one call get_ordinance_toc(state_abbr, client_name, product_name): Get full table contents one call get_jurisdiction_products(state_abbr, client_name): Get products jurisdiction one call functions automatically chain multiple API calls provide better error messages.

title: municoder - R Package Overview for AI Assistants
text: package uses renv dependency management README.Rmd generates README.md (edit .Rmd file, .md) functions documented roxygen2 “Tribes” state abbreviation known cause errors (see README line 51) HTML content ordinance text stripped cleaned get_section_text() utils-api.R: API utilities enhanced error handling utils-transform.R: Reusable data transformation helpers states.R, clients.R, products.R, jobs.R: Domain-specific functions codes.R, ordinances.R: Content retrieval functions workflows.R: High-level workflow helpers municoder-package.R: Package documentation See REFACTORING.md complete details recent improvements Error handling: API calls include automatic retry logic (3 attempts) informative error messages

title: Interface to the municode.com API
text: municoder provides R interface municode.com API, giving programmatic access municipal ordinances 1,000+ jurisdictions across 50 U.S. states territories. package enables researchers, urban planners, policy analysts access zoning codes, building ordinances, regulatory documents spatial analysis, policy research, comparative studies.

title: Interface to the municode.com API
text: can install development version library(municoder) like :

title: Interface to the municode.com API
text: Get started municoder just lines: new workflow helper functions (get_jurisdiction_products(), get_ordinance_toc(), get_ordinance_section()) automatically handle multi-step process looking IDs navigating API, making common tasks much simpler.
code: library(municoder)  # Get all jurisdictions in Virginia va_clients <- get_clients_in_state("VA")  # Get all available ordinances for Alexandria, VA (the easy way!) products <- get_jurisdiction_products(   state_abbreviation = "VA",    client_name = "Alexandria")  # Get the table of contents for Alexandria's zoning ordinance toc <- get_ordinance_toc(   state_abbreviation = "VA",    client_name = "Alexandria",    product_name = "Zoning")  # Extract a specific section of the ordinance content <- get_ordinance_section(   state_abbreviation = "VA",    client_name = "Alexandria",    product_name = "Zoning",    node_id = "ARTIIIREZORE")

what: Discovery: Find jurisdictions and their ordinances
title: Interface to the municode.com API
code: # Get all states states <- get_states()  # Get all municipalities in a state va_clients <- get_clients_in_state("VA")  # Get metadata for a specific municipality alexandria <- get_client_metadata("VA", "Alexandria")  # Get all ordinance types available for a jurisdiction products <- get_jurisdiction_products("VA", "Alexandria")

title: Interface to the municode.com API
code: # Get table of contents (the easy way) toc <- get_ordinance_toc("VA", "Alexandria", "Zoning")  # Or do it step-by-step for more control client_id <- get_client_metadata("VA", "Alexandria")$client_id product_id <- get_client_products(client_id) %>%   filter(product_name == "Zoning") %>%   pull(product_id) job_id <- get_current_version(product_id)$id toc <- get_codes_toc(job_id, product_id)

title: Interface to the municode.com API
code: # Extract a specific section (the easy way) section <- get_ordinance_section("VA", "Alexandria", "Zoning", "ARTIIIREZORE")  # Get all child sections and their content children_ids <- section %>% pull(id) all_content <- map_dfr(   children_ids,   ~ get_section_text(     product_id = product_id,      node_id = .x))

title: Interface to the municode.com API
text: Map geographic distribution jurisdictions ordinances municode.com:
code: all_states <- municoder::get_states()  all_clients <- all_states %>%   dplyr::pull(state_abbreviation) %>%   purrr::discard(~ str_detect(.x, "Tribes")) %>% ## "Tribes" throws an error for some reason   purrr::map_dfr(~ get_clients_in_state(.x))  states_sf <- tigris::states(cb = TRUE, progress_bar = FALSE) %>%   dplyr::filter(GEOID < 60) %>%   tigris::shift_geometry() %>%   dplyr::left_join(     all_clients %>% dplyr::count(state_abbreviation),     by = c("STUSPS" = "state_abbreviation")) #> Retrieving data for the year 2021  states_sf %>%   ggplot2::ggplot() +   ggplot2::geom_sf(ggplot2::aes(fill = n)) +   ggplot2::geom_sf(data = states_sf %>% dplyr::filter(n == 0), fill = "lightgrey") +   ggplot2::labs(     title = "Municode Clients Span All 51 States",     fill = "Entities with ordinances on municode.com" %>% str_wrap(30)) +   ggplot2::scale_fill_continuous(trans = "reverse") +   urbnthemes::theme_urbn_map()

title: Interface to the municode.com API
text: Compare zoning ordinance language across different zones. example examines “Purpose” statements Alexandria, VA’s residential zones identify policy priorities:
code: # Get all residential zones using the workflow helper content <- get_ordinance_section("VA", "Alexandria", "Zoning", "ARTIIIREZORE")  # Extract all child zone sections zone_ids <- content %>% dplyr::pull(id) all_zones <- purrr::map_dfr(zone_ids,   ~ get_section_text(product_id = 12429, node_id = .x))  # Filter to Purpose statements purpose_statements <- all_zones %>%   dplyr::filter(     !is.na(content),     stringr::str_detect(heading, "Purpose")) %>%   dplyr::select(heading, content)  # Do any zones mention affordability? purpose_statements %>%    dplyr::pull(content) %>%    keep(~ str_detect(.x, "affordability|affordable")) #> [1] " The RMF zone is established to provide land areas for multi-unit residential development and to enhance or preserve long-term affordability of housing. The zone would also permit limited neighborhood-serving commercial uses. "
